intro: Barleria holubii subsp. ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda barleria, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf shape and flower structure compared to other members of the Barleria holubii complex.
